node_info.subtitle: ={{$parameter[
node_info.description: Read, update and write data to Google Sheets
node_info.name: googleSheets

properties.name: operation
properties.description: Append data to a sheet

options.name: Append
options.description: Append data to a sheet

options.name: Clear
options.description: Clear data from a sheet

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a new sheet

options.name: Create or Update
options.description: Create a new record, or update the current one if it already exists (upsert)

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete columns and rows from a sheet

options.name: Lookup
options.description: Look up a specific column value and return the matching row
options.action: Look up a column value in a sheet

options.name: Read
options.description: Read data from a sheet

options.name: Remove
options.description: Remove a sheet

options.name: Update
options.description: Update rows in a sheet

properties.name: sheetId
properties.description: The ID of the Google Spreadsheet. Found as part of the sheet URL https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/{ID}/.

properties.name: range
properties.description: The table range to read from or to append data to. See the Google documentation for the details. If it contains multiple sheets it can also be added like this: "MySheet!A:F"

properties.name: toDelete
properties.description: Deletes columns and rows from a sheet

values.name: sheetId
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

values.name: startIndex
values.description: The start index (0 based and inclusive) of column to delete

values.name: sheetId
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

values.name: startIndex
values.description: The start index (0 based and inclusive) of row to delete

properties.name: rawData
properties.description: Whether the data should be returned RAW instead of parsed into keys according to their header

properties.name: dataProperty
properties.description: The name of the property into which to write the RAW data

properties.name: rawData
properties.description: Whether the data supplied is RAW instead of parsed into keys

properties.name: dataProperty
properties.description: The name of the property from which to read the RAW data

properties.name: dataStartRow
properties.description: Index of the first row which contains the actual data and not the keys. Starts with 0.

properties.name: keyRow
properties.description: Index of the row which contains the keys. Starts at 0. The incoming node data is matched to the keys for assignment. The matching is case sensitive.

properties.name: lookupColumn
properties.description: The name of the column in which to look for value

properties.name: lookupValue
properties.description: The value to look for in column

properties.name: key
properties.description: The name of the key to identify which data should be updated in the sheet

properties.name: options
properties.description: By default, the workflow stops executing if the lookup/read does not return values

options.name: continue
options.description: By default, the workflow stops executing if the lookup/read does not return values

options.name: returnAllMatches
options.description: By default only the first result gets returned. If options gets set all found matches get returned.

options.displayName: Use Header Names as JSON Paths
options.name: usePathForKeyRow
options.description: Whether you want to match the headers as path, for example, the row header "category.name" will match the "category" object and get the field "name" from it. By default "category.name" will match with the field with exact name, not nested object.

options.name: valueInputMode
options.description: The values will not be parsed and will be stored as-is

options.name: RAW
options.description: The values will not be parsed and will be stored as-is

options.name: User Entered
options.description: The values will be parsed as if the user typed them into the UI. Numbers will stay as numbers, but strings may be converted to numbers, dates, etc. following the same rules that are applied when entering text into a cell via the Google Sheets UI.

options.name: valueRenderMode
options.description: Values will be calculated & formatted in the reply according to the cell's formatting.Formatting is based on the spreadsheet's locale, not the requesting user's locale.For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return "$1.23"

options.name: Formatted Value
options.description: Values will be calculated & formatted in the reply according to the cell's formatting.Formatting is based on the spreadsheet's locale, not the requesting user's locale.For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return "$1.23"

options.name: Formula
options.description: Values will not be calculated. The reply will include the formulas. For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return "=A1".

options.name: Unformatted Value
options.description: Values will be calculated, but not formatted in the reply. For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return the number 1.23.

options.name: valueRenderMode
options.description: Values will be calculated & formatted in the reply according to the cell's formatting.Formatting is based on the spreadsheet's locale, not the requesting user's locale. For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return "$1.23".

options.name: Formatted Value
options.description: Values will be calculated & formatted in the reply according to the cell's formatting.Formatting is based on the spreadsheet's locale, not the requesting user's locale. For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return "$1.23".

options.name: Formula
options.description: Values will not be calculated. The reply will include the formulas. For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return "=A1".

options.name: Unformatted Value
options.description: Values will be calculated, but not formatted in the reply. For example, if A1 is 1.23 and A2 is =A1 and formatted as currency, then A2 would return the number 1.23.

properties.name: operation
properties.description: Create a spreadsheet

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a spreadsheet

properties.name: title
properties.description: The title of the spreadsheet

properties.name: sheetsUi
properties.description: Whether the Sheet should be hidden in the UI

values.name: propertiesUi
values.description: Whether the Sheet should be hidden in the UI

options.name: hidden
options.description: Whether the Sheet should be hidden in the UI

options.name: title
options.description: Title of the property to create

properties.name: options
properties.description:
The locale of the spreadsheet in one of the following formats:
  • en (639-1)
  • fil (639-2 if no 639-1 format exists)
  • en_US (combination of ISO language an country)

options.name: locale
options.description:
The locale of the spreadsheet in one of the following formats:
  • en (639-1)
  • fil (639-2 if no 639-1 format exists)
  • en_US (combination of ISO language an country)

options.name: autoRecalc
options.description: Default value

options.name: Default
options.description: Default value

options.name: On Change
options.description: Volatile functions are updated on every change

options.name: Minute
options.description: Volatile functions are updated on every change and every minute

options.name: Hour
options.description: Volatile functions are updated on every change and hourly

properties.name: simple
properties.description: Whether to return a simplified version of the response instead of the raw data

properties.name: options
properties.description: The number of columns in the grid

options.name: gridProperties
options.description: The number of columns in the grid

options.name: columnCount
options.description: The number of columns in the grid

options.name: columnGroupControlAfter
options.description: Whether the column grouping control toggle is shown after the group

options.name: frozenColumnCount
options.description: The number of columns that are frozen in the grid

options.name: frozenRowCount
options.description: The number of rows that are frozen in the grid

options.name: hideGridlines
options.description: Whether the grid isn't showing gridlines in the UI

options.name: rowCount
options.description: The number of rows in the grid

options.name: rowGroupControlAfter
options.description: Whether the row grouping control toggle is shown after the group

options.name: hidden
options.description: Whether the sheet is hidden in the UI, false if it's visible

options.name: rightToLeft
options.description: Whether the sheet is an RTL sheet instead of an LTR sheet

options.name: sheetId
options.description: The ID of the sheet. Must be non-negative. This field cannot be changed once set.

options.name: index
options.description: The index of the sheet within the spreadsheet

options.name: tabColor
options.description: The color of the tab in the UI

options.name: title
options.description: The Sheet name

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the sheet to delete

subProperties.name: gridProperties
subProperties.description: The number of columns in the grid

values.name: propertiesUi
values.description: Whether the Sheet should be hidden in the UI

options.name: hidden
options.description: Whether the Sheet should be hidden in the UI

options.name: title
options.description: Title of the property to create

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
